CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Danish Defence Acquisition and Logistics Organizations

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Danish Defence Acquisition and Logistics Organizations

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Non-magnetic drysuits for the Danish Defence

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The Danish Acquisition and Logistics Organization (DALO) is currently in the proces of preparing a tender for non-magnetic drysuits and parts associated with deep diving. This Prior Information Notice is intended to:
1) prepare future possible tenderers of the coming tender;
2) provide DALO with input to the current material, which is uploaded under “tendering material”,
3) answer general questions, which need clarification from DALO.

DALO hopes that everyone interested in such a tender will take the time to access and comment on both “Appendix A — Requirements Specifications” and the “Questions Spreadsheet” as all input will be taken into account in order to form the most optimal tendering material in the near future.
Below follows the description of DALO's initial thoughts with regards to the scope of the future Framework Agreement:
The primary users are the Danish EOD/MCM divers but the suits will also be used in the entire Royal Danish Navy (RDN) and Special Forces in all climate zones for a variety of tasks.

The suits will be used for diving to a depth of a maximum of 100 meters, as well as being used as the diver’s primary surface suits suit when working in or around the Danish Defence’s RHIB’s, when operating from larger ships and for a variety of tasks on ground.
It is therefore of uttermost importance that the suits have a large freedom of movement and at the same time are robust in order to be used as the primary suit when working in the boat or on ground.
DALO expect to purchase 4 different standard configurations (but with the same overall design), which are described more in detail in Appendix A.

DALO expects to make an initial acquisition of approximately 200 standard size suits to be delivered within 6 months from the signing of the Framework Agreement. Afterwards, DALO expects to make acquisitions in lots of either 1-10 standard size suits or 11-50 standard size suits. Furthermore DALO expect to purchase a small number of special / optional size suits.
Besides the purchase of drysuits and the parts associated with deep diving, the Framework Agreement also covers repair services, hotline service and training services.

In the final offer evaluation, DALO expects to put a lot of emphasis on the quality of the delivered test samples and the overall qualitative evaluation requirements, however still with a significant weight on the prices offered.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: DALO uses the electronic platform of Ethics for this RFI. At the noted web address Suppliers can find the RFI document. The documents shall be downloaded and answered. When filled-in, please return the document by uploading it to Ethics.
DALO kindly ask to have the filled-in document returned no later than the 1.5.2018.
DALO would to thank you in advance for your kind assistance in this RFI.
